snippet: A final House vote this Thursday amounts to a Republican bet that voters will reward the party for its tough-love priorities on spending.
abstract: Republican-led House will lay bare the choice between social programs and Pentagon spending when it votes on budget legislation to slice $261 billion from social service programs over the next decade to stave off more than $50 billion in military spending cuts scheduled to take effect in 2013.
lead_paragraph: A final House vote this Thursday amounts to a Republican bet that voters will reward the party for its tough-love priorities on spending.

headline.main: House Bill Offers Aid Cuts to Save Military Spending
headline.print_headline: House Bill Offers Aid Cuts To Save Military Spending

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
